definition: to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: He handled the gaggle of media, sponsors and fans with extraordinary aplomb .
sentences.chinese: 他处理的媒体，赞助商和球迷们以非凡的沉着鹅群。

sentences.english: But now sponsors and advertisers are growing wary of association with a sport riven with drug abuse.
sentences.chinese: 现在赞助商和广告主终于对环法的药物滥用发难了。

sentences.english: Sponsors are identified on the Keiretsu Forum web site.
sentences.chinese: 赞助商在Keiretsu论坛会的网站上被认可。

sentences.english: The film opened on a long lingering shot of the sponsors' vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 影片的开头是一个关于赞助商车子的长镜头。

sentences.english: The sponsor threatened not to pay up.
sentences.chinese: 赞助商以不付款为要挟。

sentences.english: 'This will only get more uncomfortable for organizers and sponsors, ' she says.
sentences.chinese: “这将会让奥运会组织者和赞助商处境更糟，”她说。

sentences.english: Mr. Li Chi Keung, Director of MJC, has a group photo with representatives of the sponsors of the Charity Day.
sentences.chinese: 澳门赛马会董事李志强先生与一众赞助商代表合照。

sentences.english: Accept the card sponsors, she participated in the Nationwide Tour.
sentences.chinese: 接受赞助商外卡，她参加了纳信怀德巡回赛。

sentences.english: Rather, big sponsors tend to be firms with brands that are already well-known.
sentences.chinese: 相反，大赞助商常是那些品牌家喻户晓的公司。

sentences.english: Design would also need to incorporate the team name and the sponsors name.
sentences.chinese: 设计也需要纳入队名和赞助商的名字。

sentences.english: The group gave passing grades to only a few sponsors.
sentences.chinese: 该组织只给少数几家赞助商打了“及格”分。

sentences.english: Since, we have let the sponsor choose whoever they would like as a cancer charity.
sentences.chinese: 从此，我们允许赞助商为癌症慈善机构选择捐赠对象。

sentences.english: They must also learn to work with sponsors.
sentences.chinese: 他们还必须学会与赞助商打交道。

sentences.english: Registration for this event is FREE for anyone who is a client (or potentially uses the services) of our sponsors.
sentences.chinese: 本次活动的仅对赞助商之所有客户开放免费注册。

sentences.english: Of course, Olympic sponsors risk the possibility of bad publicity.
sentences.chinese: 当然，奥运赞助商也冒不良宣传可能性的风险。

sentences.english: One reason for less-than-full venues could be that seats allocated to corporate sponsors are not being used.
sentences.chinese: 空位的一个原因，是分配给赞助商的座位没有被使用。

definition: club (the organisation or its premises) (loanword)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be a spokesperson/to be an ambassador (for a brand)/to endorse
